1.content:
First, pick an arc for the general timeline of these events.

Saiyan Arc - Includes immediate post-Dragon Ball events, the arrival of Raditz, and the Vegeta Saga.

Frieza Arc - Includes post-Saiyan arc events, the Namek Saga, the Captain Ginyu Saga, the Frieza / Super Saiyan Saga, and Garlic Jr. Saga.

Cell Arc - Includes post-Frieza arc events, the Trunks Saga, the Android Saga, the Imperfect Cell Saga, the Perfect Cell Saga, and the Cell Games Saga.

Buu Arc - Includes post-Cell arc events, the Great Saiyaman Saga, the World Tournament Saga, the Babidi Saga, the Majin Buu Saga, the Fusion Saga, and the Kid Buu Saga.

Other - Includes Dragon Ball events, Dragon Ball GT events, Dragon Ball manga events (that don't normally occur during the series), distant past and future events (which is great for OCs, and can also include historical Planet Vegeta as a setting), and generally anything else that doesn't fit in the categories above.

1311223.content:
Nikki Town was ordinarily a nice place to live, but the news reports as of late had some people feeling a little wary. There was a small thread of mysterious yet vast crimes spreading from town to town. They seemed almost supernatural. Small artifacts from police dash cams and surveillance cameras in some of the affected areas showed broken, fuzzy footage of two shapes wreaking havoc. It concerned you a lot, but most of the residents of Nikki Town didn't seem alarmed at all, and some even joked about the report.

The thoughts came to you most when you walked home. There was about a mile long stretch behind commercial buildings where, when you walked, you were totally alone. It was sort of an industrial nook. Nothing anyone would want to walk through. It wasn't pretty. But it was quiet, and it was the shortest route home for you.

Something seemed off today. Perhaps you had been thinking too much about these enigmatic figures, because just a moment ago, you could have sworn there was a change in the air, and that you'd seen something fly overhead faster than the fastest jet. You paused, looking up at the sky, heart beating fast.

Just as you'd begun to convince yourself it was nothing, in the blink of an instant, a blonde woman stood before you, smirking. Her eyes weren't quite right. Your breath hitched, and you weren't sure whether to run or hold perfectly still.

"Hello," 18 said, reaching a hand out to grip the top of your scalp. You winced. Her grip was like a metal clamp being tightened around your cranium. It hurt incredibly, and nothing you could have done would release you from that hold. "I need a toilet," she said coolly.

You wrenched an eye open. "T-there's a public restroom on Dinky Avenue," you said between painfully gritted teeth.

She released you, watching you crumple to the ground to nurse your skull. "No, I already found one." She nudged your shoulder with her foot, turning you over onto your back. She looked you over sanctimoniously. "Women like you exist for that exact reason," she said with a laugh.

18 moved to stand over you, her feet on either side of your head. She pulled down her skirt and leggings and lowered herself to your face. It was evident she was going to...

15.content:
Which other timeline should this take place in?

Dragon Ball - Includes the Goku Arc, the Red Ribbon Army Arc, and the Piccolo Arc.

Dragon Ball GT - Includes post-Dragon Ball Z events, the Black Star Dragon Ball Saga, the Baby Saga, the Super 17 Saga, and the Shadow Dragon Saga.

The Past - Includes anything that occurred before the events of Dragon Ball, fanon or canon.

The Future - Includes anything that could or did occur beyond the timeline of Dragon Ball Z or Dragon Ball GT, discluding GT itself. (Dragon Ball GT events should happen in the Dragon Ball GT category, but if you choose to disregard GT entirely and override the events therein due to Akira Toriyama's declaration that GT is not canon, use "The Future" category.)

Other - Including anything not covered in the topics above or preceding this chapter. This is the best category to use for OCs in an original or DBZ-esque environment that won't fit in any other categories, or time-travel arcs that make it difficult to categorize your story in any other section. This is great for fanons, off-shoots, and cross-overs.

153111.title: Giné: Before or after they marry?

choices: Her pod malfunctions and she is separated from the team.
She lands near the others but gets injured from the landing.
1531111.content:
[Author's Hint: To get the special é character, you can key ALT+0233 (numpad). The accent was added to try to help people say her name correctly, with a hard G (instead of a J-sound) and an é alike to the é in café or cliché.]

Giné was a slight, spindly little lower-class Saiyan with unevenly chopped, unruly black hair, and a terribly gentle nature. She was one of few Saiyans who weren't quite cut out to be warriors. Of course, the battlefield always had more males than females serving Frieza's army or other personal endeavors, if they were fortunate enough to go AWOL, but most female Saiyans were still battle-hardy and combat ready. This made Giné something of a pariah amongst her people.

Nonetheless, she was forced onto the battlefield by the Saiyan race's new ally (or master, little did many think of it), Frieza's forces. She was assigned to a team of other low-class warrors, led by the enigmatic Bardock. Today was her first real off-planet mission with them outside of basic training. In recent training scenarios, she had failed, fumbled, and floundered time and time again, earning Bardock's and his team's contempt, although unlike the others, he always seemed to have his eye on her. She wasn't sure if he was concerned or overly scrutinizing. Or maybe just lusty.

Giné had some time to stew over this, alone in her pod chasing behind the other five or so pods, just about to enter the atmosphere of the alien planet. Her pod had been a little unstable, occasionally rolling and tumbling, with plenty of turbulence once they entered the atmosphere. It was a harrowing journey, and she was more than certain she'd been assigned a pod in need of repairs due to the fact that she was little more than a liability on this journey.
1531111.title: Before

choices: He finds Giné trapped in her pod.
He finds Giné thrown from her pod and unconscious.
He finds Giné limping along aimlessly.
15311113.content:
One by one, the Saiyan pods landed in the auburn grasslands of the alien planet, digging deep craters and scars into an otherwise uninterrupted expanse of wild grass. The overcast sky had puncture wounds from the pods digging through the clouds, allowing some sunlight to beam through. Ordinarily, the atmosphere would give this planet a somewhat dull-blue sky, which turned yellow and bright orange during the five or so hours of sundown this particular area on the planet experienced. The valley revealed mountains on the horizon in nearly every direction.

Bardock was the first to emerge, meeting up with Tora, Borgos, Shugesh, Fasha and the other forces. Little by little, each of the warriors began to draw towards the point where they'd set up camp, and they had already started to do so when their idle banter during set up turned to Giné.

Smug as a skunk, Fasha smirked, tying off one of the stakes for an above ground camp. There were no mountains close enough to simply blast a cave into, though Saiyans were most comfortable in such settings. Tents were fine enough, and the gigantic carnivorous lizards meandering the valleys had provided plenty of tarp to that end. "I wonder if Giné got eaten by now."

The others laughed. Bardock, however, frowned, either out of anger or concern. Either way, he didn't find the joke much to laugh at. He sighed exasperatedly. "I'll go find her. If anything, we could use cannon fodder," he said coldly. He looked to Tora, a serious expression on his face. "You have command Tora. Keep everyone in line until I return."

Tora rolled a muscled shoulder in partial acknowledgement, then turned his head and spat.

Bardock nodded, satisfied enough with the answer and took off, flying into the distance where a small beam of sunlight was still shining through the punch in the clouds. It was the only direction none of his elite came from, and had to have been Giné. His face hardened, and he picked up the pace.
15311113.title: She lands near the others but gets injured from...

153111132.content:
As Bardock continued his scouting, he noticed smoke in the horizon. It was dark, black smoke, making him grit his teeth. He knew that ops gave her an older, less stable pod, saving the better pods for squads made of middle and top class Saiyan warriors, and even the garbage they'd been given was dealt to each warrior on grounds of usefulness. They weren't supposed to malfunction at all, but when they did, it was assured that the malfunction would happen amid a low class troupe.

Bardock scowled as he came to the wreckage, landing before the pod. The pod's door had been torn off and twisted, along with half of the sphere itself. Broken glass and blood speckled the ground, but Giné wasn't inside. He took off from the ground again, pausing mid-air to glance about, his scouter chirping as it searched for signs of life. A faint signal of a grievously low power level finally locked on. For a moment, he wasn't sure if it was Giné or some sort of deer or antelope, but that mystery was solved by a simple turn.

He glowered down at the crumpled body of Giné. No limbs were missing, and her injuries seemed mostly superficial. She might have hit her head a little, or passed out from fright. Either way, Bardock wasn't impressed. He slowly drifted down to Giné, taking a knee beside her and checking her vitals.

"You'll survive," he told her gruffly, although she wasn't conscious to hear him.
153111132.title: He finds Giné thrown from her pod and unconsci...

choices: He shakes her roughly to wake her.
He doesn't wake her and squats over her face.
1531111321.content:
He withdrew his hand from the pressure point behind her ear, gritting his teeth. "This is a simple mission. I can't believe you've already botched it before you even began. You could have at least been a useful chef, but no."

He reached out and grabbed a fistful of dried, turned earth, throwing it at her in his frustration. "I wasted my time, coming out here for you. If you weren't a decent looking woman, I'd kill you right here and now."

Bardock fell silent, watching Giné a moment longer, his rage and frustration mounting. He really was annoyed with her, having strove to be as strong as he could be despite the circumstances he was born to. She couldn't even muster that. She was either lazy or pathetic. No, she wasn't lazy. She was a try-hard, but she was weak, and entirely too gentle to do anything of worth on the battlefield but tend to the wounded. He wanted to punish her for this affront to his way of life, and his philosophy.

His stomach twisted, groaning audibly, unhappy with the rations he'd snacked on during their flight. It never really did sit very well with him. Of course, that gave him an idea.
1531111321.title: Berate her.

15311113212.content:
Watching her a moment longer, Bardock starts to chuckle to himself. He knew the perfect thing to do to this weakling that seemed to fit the crime. His bowels were aching for some relief from the gas pains beginning to build up, and he never had any qualms with letting one rip loudly in private. He even kind of liked the raunchiness of his own smell usually.

Still in his full armor, he put his feet flat on the ground, on either side of her head. He looked over his shoulder, tail flicking anxiously, if not excitedly, before he bent his knees and squatted above her face. His cloth-clad muscular ass hung just a few inches above Giné's nose and gently parted lips.

Smirking to himself, he couldn't help but get a little excited by the depravity of what he was planning on doing to this unconscious girl. He tensed, then grunted, forcing out a loud, hot fart, which seemed to pass through his armor as though it wasn't even there. It was hot against Giné's face and reeked of week old eggs.

He laughed callously, adjusting his stance a little to creep an inch or two closer, butt wiggling above her. He looked over his shoulder, glaring down imperiously at the top of her head. "Yeah, that's what you deserve. Be my little fart cushion," he taunted.

He held his breath, and another trumpeted out from his sphincter, making a somewhat wet hum as it squeaked past his ass and into Giné's face. The smell clung to the underside of his tail and to the soft skin of Giné.
15311113212.title: He doesn't wake her and squats over her face.

15311113213.content:
Bardock took his scouter off, tossing it to the side. He looked Giné up and down, smirking to himself. She really was pretty cute, despite her incredible worthlessness, and she roused him in a strange way. Feeling stronger than another was arousing in and of itself. He didn't work as hard as he had to be bested by others, of course. Especially not a woman. She deserved to be weaker than him, and as such, she deserved to be totally dominated by him.

The strong took from the weak. That was the Saiyan way.

Aroused, he removed his pants, his long, thick member semi-erect at the sight of her, but what to do about that, he wasn't sure. There were a lot of mixed desires in him. On one hand, he wanted to simply defile her. To maybe take a leak on her like she was garbage.
